caption:
This photograph captures a colorful and playful outdoor scene, likely during a school or community event. It features three young girls dressed in charming bee costumes, complete with transparent wings and black antennae headbands. The costumes include black tops and black shorts accented with bright orange belts.

In the foreground, a large, eye-catching flower made from red, yellow, and pink tissue or crepe paper adds a vibrant touch to the scene. The flower, which stands taller than the children, appears meticulously crafted to look lively and festive.

The background shows a portion of a building with large windows and a white facade, suggesting the event is taking place in an urban or suburban setting. The overall atmosphere is joyful and festive, likely part of a parade or a performance that involves children dressed as various elements of nature. The lighting is bright, suggesting it's a sunny day, which casts soft shadows and enhances the cheerful ambiance of the scene.
title: Children's float in a parade held annually at cottonwood falls, Kansas, near Emporia.  It is part of festivities of the flint hills rodeo, a major cultural event of the area.  Horses and large cattle trucks are the featured modes of transportation.  It is a 19th century "cowboy" town in the heart of the Kansas flint hills region and near an area designated as a possible site for a tallgrass prairie national park
